greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1 + 2*x^2) / ((1 - x^2)^2 * (1 - x^3) * (1 - x^4)) in powers of x.
comment: The number of quadruples of integers [x, u, v, w] which satisfy x > u > v > w >=0, n+7 = x+u, u+v != x+w, and x+u+v+w is even.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,2,1,0,-2,-2,0,1,2,0,-1).
formula: a(n+3) - a(n) = 0 if n even else A006578((n+5)/2) for all n in Z.
a(n) = -A254708(-9 - n) for all n in Z.
mathematica: a[ n_] := Length @ FindInstance[ {x > u, u > v, v > w, w >= 0, x + u == n + 7, u + v != x + w, x + u + v + w == 2 k}, {x, u, v, w, k}, Integers, 10^9];
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Feb 06 2015
